title: Manor House That Inspired Writer Thomas Hardy Lists in Dorset
text:
A stately stone manor house that comes complete with an impressive literary history is ready for a new lord or lady.



Woolbridge Manor stands on the outskirts of the traditional English village of Wool, in the county of Dorset on the country’s southwest coast.



More: Converted Warehouse in London’s Covent Garden on the Market for £3.5M

It hit the market in early September with an asking price of £850,000 (US$1.05 million).



The house, which dates to the 17th century, once belonged to the Turberville family who provided inspiration for the similarly named d’Urberville family in Thomas Hardy’s famed 1891 novel “Tess of the d’Urbervilles.”



The house itself inspired Wellbridge House in the Dorset-native’s book, the family’s ancestral home and where protagonist Tess and her new husband Angel spent their miserable honeymoon.



An old tradition, mentioned in the novel, says that a ghostly coach crosses the bridge next to the home at night, but—luckily for new buyers—can only be seen by members of the Turberville family, according to a news release from listing agency Savills.



“Woolbridge Manor is a landmark property with fascinating literary connections,” Jamie Morten, of Savills Wimborne, said in the release. Though in need of complete modernization and refurbishment, “the house offers an incredible opportunity to purchase a real slice of history and for the buyer to improve and personalise to their own specifications,” he said.

The five-bedroom home has retained many period features, including fireplaces and exposed beams, according to the listing.



There’s also a reception hall with a flagstone and tiled floor, a sitting room with a decorative plaster ceiling and a master bedroom with views across the countryside.

Gardens surround the house on three sides, and outbuildings include a thatched shed, storage rooms, and a brick and flint building known as Chapel Barn, thought to be a former chapel and now used as a garage with more storage.



Mansion Global could not determine the current owner of the home.
